events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle on the highway late last night, requesting to file the claim immediately.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to keywords related to a vehicle collision submitted in the initial report.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this auto accident claim and will contact the customer within the next 24 hours.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer of prompt processing and support throughout the process.
The agent requested police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver's license to proceed with the investigation.
All requested documents including the police report and vehicle repair estimates were submitted by the customer via the online portal.
The insurance company initiated a formal investigation to verify the details of the vehicle collision and assess the claim validity.
Investigation concluded confirming the collision scenario as described, and the extent of damages matched reported documentation.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering repairs, less applicable deductibles according to the policy terms.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of the claim and agreed to the proposed settlement figures.
Following customer's agreement, the claim was officially approved and prepared for payment disbursement.
The settlement payment was issued to the customerâ€™s account to cover the approved repair costs for their vehicle.
The auto accident claim was formally closed following payment, with no further actions required from either party.
The claim documentation and records were archived securely for future reference in compliance with company policy.
